news.title: Land acquisition for Gurugram metro picks up
news.para: The land acquisition process for the Gurgaon Metro project has accelerated with the first Land Purchase Committee meeting. The committee, chaired by the deputy commissioner, reviewed land requirements and prioritized ownership verification for corridor-1. Notifications for both corridors are expected soon, with compensation based on higher norms as per the new policy.

news.title: Bengaluru development body plans graded penalty cut for vacant sites citywide
news.para: BDA may replace flat ten percent levy with size-linked charges, hoping owners regularise properties and build on nearly 68,000 vacant plots spread across Bengaluru layouts after years idle and disputes

news.title: In two weeks, Greater Noida seals 100 illegal flats, frees over 54,000 sq metres on Hindon floodplains
news.para: Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority has reclaimed over 54,000 sqm of encroached land in five villages, demolishing illegal structures and sealing eight residential towers. This enforcement drive, targeting environmentally sensitive areas along the Hindon floodplain, aims to curb unauthorized construction and protect restricted zones. Action continues against illegal plotting and construction without proper approvals.

news.title: Property sales, registrations barred in Valley View Estate in Gurugram as licence lapses
news.para: Haryana's Town and Country Planning department has halted property sale deeds in Gurugram's Valley View Estate due to an expired development license. The 21.61-acre colony's license, issued in 1994, lapsed in 2011 and was not renewed, impacting residents and potential buyers. Authorities have ordered a 'red entry' in revenue records to prevent further transactions.

news.title: Telangana government is considering significant changes to building regulations
news.para: Telangana government is set to revise building regulations, easing developer burdens. Key changes include reducing mandatory mortgaged built-up space from 10% to 5%, rationalizing NOCs for water bodies, and extending project completion timelines. Floor heights will also see a 10% increase, offering greater design flexibility for builders.

news.title: Two years on, club in Gurugram’s Malibu Towne shut, residents seek reopening
news.para: Malibu Towne residents are urging the DTCP to de-seal the country club, shut for two years due to compliance issues. The developer has rectified deficiencies and renewed the township license, with an occupation certificate application pending. Reopening the club will restore vital community and recreational spaces for over 10,000 residents.

news.title: Standard Chartered Bank sells office in Mumbai’s BKC for ₹197 crore
news.para: Standard Chartered Bank has sold a commercial property in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex. Advanced Realty acquired the office space for Rs 197 crore. The transaction highlights a trend of corporates rebalancing their real estate portfolios. This move allows for capital unlocking and a shift towards asset-light strategies. BKC remains a prime office location.

news.title: Mumbai: BMC issues stop-work notice to transit camp being built on plot reserved for sewage plant
news.para: BMC has issued a stop-work notice for a Worli transit camp built on land reserved for a sewage treatment plant. Officials are concerned about disturbed sewer lines potentially causing flooding. An executive engineer is facing a criminal complaint for allegedly illegally granting permissions, with accusations of collusion with developers.

news.title: Evergrande liquidators weigh revised bids for majority stake in property services arm
news.para: As China Evergrande Group grapples with substantial creditor demands, its liquidators are currently evaluating new offers for a dominant stake in its property management division, valued at over one billion dollars. With initial proposals off the table, the timeline for finalizing a deal remains uncertain.

news.title: Delhi slum dwellers await improved housing, public amenities as government looks to revamp 18,000 flats
news.para: Residents of Delhi's JJ clusters will soon see improved living conditions. The Delhi government, with NBCC, plans to refurbish 18,000 flats.   This initiative aims to address long-standing issues and enhance the quality of life for thousands of families.

news.title: HeidelbergCement India's profit jumps three-fold to ₹15.6 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: HeidelbergCement India has announced a significant jump in its net profit for the December quarter of FY26. The company's profit surged threefold compared to the same period last year. Revenue from operations also saw an increase, driven by higher sales volumes.

news.title: Puducherry government implementing housing subsidy scheme to ensure concrete structures for poor: CM
news.para: Puducherry Chief Minister N Rangasamy is implementing a housing scheme to replace huts with concrete homes for the poor. Enhanced pensions are being provided to the elderly and destitute. The Union Territory aims to become hut-free soon.

news.title: Embassy REIT's net operating income up 19% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Embassy REIT posted a 19% surge in net operating income and a 17% leap in revenues in Q3 FY26. The company declared a distribution of ₹613 crore or ₹6.47 per unit for the quarter.

news.title: Max Estates registers significant dip in profit in Q3 FY26
news.para: Max Estates has shared its financial update for the quarter ending December 31, 2025, showcasing a net consolidated profit after tax of ₹2.53 lakh. This represents a notable decrease from last year's ₹15.81 crore. The overall income also reflected a minor dip.

news.title: Prism Johnson's net profit rises 8.47% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Prism Johnson announced a profit increase of 8.47 percent for the quarter ending December 31, 2025. Net profit after tax reached ₹49.93 crore. Total income saw a slight decrease. Cement sales volume grew, with a significant rise in premium product share. The tiles segment remained stable.

news.title: Skanska's profit rises to $332.3 million in Q4 2025
news.para: Swedish construction giant Skanska reported fourth-quarter earnings that fell short of market expectations. The recovery of the Nordic housing market continues to be sluggish, although commercial and residential property development is gradually seeing some positive signs.

news.title: Omaxe posts net loss of ₹153.20 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Omaxe has announced its financial results for the quarter ending December 31, 2025. The company reported a net consolidated loss after tax of ₹153.20 crore.  However, the company's total income saw a rise of 6.21 percent. It also acquired two new subsidiaries during this quarter.

news.title: Veris Residential being pushed to sell itself: Sources
news.para: Erez Asset Management is urging Veris Residential to investigate the possibility of a sale, hinting at a substantial 70 percent premium for shareholders. Known for its upscale rental properties, Veris is being advised to launch a thorough review of their strategic options following earlier interest from Jared Kushner’s family business.

news.title: Shree Cements' net profit rises 38.16% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Shree Cements has reported a substantial 38.16% increase in its net consolidated profit for the quarter ending December 31, 2025, reaching an impressive ₹267.65 crore. The company also enjoyed a total income growth of 5.61% during the said quarter.

news.title: Ashiana Housing acquires 8.83 acres land in Maharashtra
news.para: Ashiana Housing has secured land in Maharashtra for a new senior living development. The company will develop a project with a 4.50 lakh sq ft saleable area. In a separate move, the company has partnered with Epoch Elder Care. Epoch Elder Care will manage operations for Ashiana Care Homes in Bhiwadi.
